intro: Eurya cordata, commonly known as the broadleaf eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to eastern Asia, including regions of China, Japan, and Korea. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptic to ovate in shape, with a glossy dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Eurya cordata produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue to black berries.
